column2: NH DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. This sign means drivers must not pass other vehicles:
column6: unless it is safe to do so.

column2: 2. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
3. While driving, it is important to slow down:
4. This road sign means:
5. This road sign means:
column8: Cars in right lane must slow down
column10: Pass only in the right lane

column2: 6. What does a red arrow on a traffic light mean?
column4: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column6: You must stop. Do not go in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column8: You may proceed slowly through the intersection.
column10: You may turn in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 7. This sign means:
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 8. Highway markings:
column4: are usually red and blue in color.
column10: are only found in school zones.

column2: 9. ______________ is an unsafe distraction when driving.
column4: Asking a passenger to enter your mapping request into your GPS.
column6: Leaving early to drive to an appointment.
column8: Texting a message on your cell phone.
column10: Controlling an emotion before putting the vehicle in gear.

column2: 10. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 21. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: gives you time to react to situations.
column8: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.

column2: 22. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column6: to keep the front wheels straight.
column8: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column10: in the direction you want to go.

column2: 23. When driving in fog:
24. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column6: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column8: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column10: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.

column2: 25. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column6: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column10: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 26. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 27. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
28. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

column2: 29. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
30. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: apply the brake and slow down.
column6: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.
column8: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.

column2: 31. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
32. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column8: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 33. The picture shows a _________ sign.
34. This road sign means:
35. Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot:
column4: on all right and left turns.
column6: when pulling to the right side of the road or away from a curb.

column2: 36. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: where there is a red light.
column6: at an intersection with a stop sign.
column8: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.

column2: 37. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column8: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column10: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.

column2: 38. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
39. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column6: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column8: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column10: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.

column2: 40. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column10: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
